context: [3] Strain SYR1 showed optimal growth at NaCl concentrations of 0 to 30 mM (note that the standard medium already contained 28 mM sodium sulfate).  [4] MT and DMS formation occurred up to 135 mM NaCl.  [5] The tolerance of strain SYR1 to high concentrations of syringate and acetate was tested in order to be able to predict the behavior of strain SYR1 during cultivation of high quantities of cell biomass.  [6] In cultures with higher concentrations of syringate, sodium sulfide was added in pulses (2.5 mM) to avoid both toxicity and depletion of sulfide.  [7] Strain SYR1 showed optimal growth at syringate concentrations of 2.5 to 7.5 mM.  [8] At higher concentrations (tested up to 20 mM), growth was observed but appeared to be lower and less predictable.  [9] Moreover, in cultures grown with increasing concentrations of syringate, the concentrations of acetate produced did not increase proportionally to the amount of syringate added.

llm_generation.summary: In this context, Methylsulfanylmethane is not directly mentioned or linked to physiologic pulse. The focus is on the growth conditions and metabolic behavior of strain SYR1 under varying concentrations of syringate and sodium sulfide. There is no discussion of how Methylsulfanylmethane might influence or relate to physiological parameters such as pulse rate or function.
